intro: Urophyllum andamanicum, commonly known as the Andaman star-leaf, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
